Question:
This question asks about learning nearest neighbor (NN) classifiers. Assume that we are using Euclidean distance squared as the distance metric, i.e. $d\left(x, x^{\prime}\right)=\left\|x-x^{\prime}\right\|^{2}$. 
Draw on the below figure the decision boundary for a 1-NN classifier on this data set. In each region, denote whether the classification of any point (any point, not just the training data) in that region would be $+1$ or $-1$. (Note, all data points are assumed to be on integer coordinates.)
